revealed_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
revealed_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.

hidden_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
hidden_symptoms.ulceration: It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
hidden_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
hidden_symptoms.nodule formation: It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
hidden_symptoms.evolving: This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.
hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.border irregularity: The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
hidden_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, I’ve got a couple of things. One is this spot that’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in. And it's super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
Thanks for sharing that with me. Can you tell me where this spot is located on your body, and how long has it been there?
It's on my back, and I think I've noticed it for maybe a few months now.
Okay. Can you describe the shape and size of the spot? Has it changed in size, shape, or color since you first noticed it?
Well, it's kind of an odd shape, not a perfect circle or anything. And yeah, I feel like it's changed a bit. The colors seem to be getting more mixed up, and I think it's gotten a little bigger.
Thank you. Can you tell me more about the colors? Are there any areas that are red, blue, or black in addition to the brown? Also, has the spot ever bled or scabbed?
Yes, there are definitely areas that are red and black, along with the brown. And sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
Thank you. Does anyone in your family have a history of skin cancer?
I don't know, I'm not sure.

Based on your description, this sounds like a suspicious skin lesion. I recommend you get this checked out by a dermatologist as soon as possible. They might want to perform a biopsy to determine the cause of the spot. We should also check to see if your family has any history of skin cancer.
Okay, I'll try to get an appointment. Should I be worried?

I understand your concern. It's important to get this checked out promptly. While I can't provide a definitive diagnosis without further tests, the changes you've described, particularly the bleeding and color changes, warrant further investigation. A biopsy will help determine what the spot is. Please don't delay scheduling that appointment.
Okay, I'll schedule an appointment as soon as I can.

Great. Please make sure you mention the bleeding and color changes when you make the appointment. It's important to get it looked at quickly. I strongly recommend you prioritize getting an appointment, because this needs further investigation. Please let me know if you have any questions. Otherwise, that's all the information I need for now.
Okay, I will. Thank you, Doctor.
